title: Framingham Risk Score for Hard Coronary Heart Disease
description: Estimates 10-year risk of myocardial infarction in patients aged 30-79 with no history of coronary heart disease or diabetes

result.name: risk_percentage
result.description: 10-year risk of hard coronary heart disease events

ranges.interpretation: Less than 5% 10-year risk of hard coronary heart disease events. Continue standard preventive measures including healthy lifestyle modifications.
5-10% 10-year risk of hard coronary heart disease events. Consider additional risk factors and intensive lifestyle modifications. May benefit from statin therapy in some cases.
10-20% 10-year risk of hard coronary heart disease events. Strong consideration for pharmacotherapy (statins) in addition to intensive lifestyle modifications.
Greater than 20% 10-year risk of hard coronary heart disease events. Definite indication for pharmacotherapy and aggressive risk factor modification.

references: Wilson PW, D'Agostino RB, Levy D, Belanger AM, Silbershatz H, Kannel WB. Prediction of coronary heart disease using risk factor categories. Circulation. 1998;97(18):1837-47. doi: 10.1161/01.cir.97.18.1837.

D'Agostino RB Sr, Vasan RS, Pencina MJ, Wolf PA, Cobain M, Massaro JM, Kannel WB. General cardiovascular risk profile for use in primary care: the Framingham Heart Study. Circulation. 2008;117(6):743-53. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.107.699579.

JAMA. 2001;285(19):2486-97. doi: 10.1001/jama.285.19.2486.
formula: Gender-specific logarithmic regression equation using age, cholesterol levels, blood pressure, smoking status, and treatment history
notes: Not recommended for patients with diabetes or known coronary heart disease
Based on Framingham Heart Study population data from 1998
Estimates risk of hard CHD events (MI, coronary death)
Age range limited to 30-79 years for validation
Consider newer risk calculators (ASCVD) for more recent population data
